subject: Should we inject the logger? (Re: [junit] How to test a method that logs to a file)

Stephen Smith wrote:
> 
> 
> Use the Dependency Injection pattern to inject your Logger into your 
> class, and then use JMock or a similar mocking API
> to assert that the logger is called with your expected parameters.

An interesting question: should we really inject the Logger? If we did 
that everywhere, then everything would depend on Logger. Is that wise?
